title: Shinji Sarusawa
text:
is a <a href="Japanese%20people">Japanese</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and manager.
Playing career.
Sarusawa was born in <a href="Hiroshima%20Prefecture">Hiroshima Prefecture</a> on June 9, 1969. After graduating from <a href="Osaka%20University%20of%20Health%20and%20Sport%20Sciences">Osaka University of Health and Sport Sciences</a>, he played <a href="Kamatamare%20Sanuki">Kagawa Shiun</a> from 1992 to 1999.
Coaching career.
In 2017, Sarusawa became a coach at <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a> club <a href="Renofa%20Yamaguchi%20FC">Renofa Yamaguchi FC</a> under manager <a href="Nobuhiro%20Ueno">Nobuhiro Ueno</a>. In May when Renofa was at the 20th place of 22 clubs, manager Ueno resigned for poor results. Sarusawa managed the club as caretaker. Although Sarusawa managed 2 matches, Renofa lost both matches. In June, <a href="Carlos%20Mayor">Carlos Mayor</a> became new manager, so Sarusawa he resigned as manager.
